# arrowDirection

**Instance Property**

The direction the arrow of the editing menu is pointing.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var arrowDirection: UIMenuController.ArrowDirection { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can set the direction editing-menu arrow points by assigning a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuController/ArrowDirection-swift.enum] enum constant to this property. The default behavior ([doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMenuController/ArrowDirection-swift.enum/default]) is to point up or down at the object of focus based on its location on the screen.

## Positioning the menu

- **menuFrame**: Returns the frame of the editing menu.
- **UIMenuController.ArrowDirection**: The direction the arrow of the editing menu is pointing.
- **setTargetRect(_:in:)**: Sets the area in a view above or below which the editing menu is positioned.
